name: Center for Collaborative and On-Demand Computing
overview:
The Marist Center for Applied Research in Collaborative and On-Demand Computing’s (CCODC) mission is to help New York State business and industry benefit from the application of cutting-edge collaborative and on-demand computing technologies, which are rapidly transforming the marketplace. The CCODC offers services, project management, support and state of the art workforce development to assist new and existing companies in applying technologies to enhance business operations at a substantial cost savings.

The CCODC at Marist College is an innovative program partially funded by the New York State Foundation for Science, Technology, and Innovation to assist businesses throughout New York State with affordable access to innovative technology research, product development, and IT support.
